alert.note: Alert for Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 3:40PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marion County through 415 PM CST... At 339 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Salem, or near Kokomo, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kokomo around 345 PM CST. Holly Springs around 355 PM CST. Morgantown around 400 PM CST. Columbia around 405 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for south central Mississippi.
